item.content:encoded:

Similarly, it has a 4-gigabit LAN port that can help you connect your devices directly. So use some devices wirelessly and some through direct cable connection. This would provide you with greater efficiency. Most people are concerned that the router might not be efficient for multiple devices, but its MU-MIMO 5GHz band helps to connect multiple devices.

This dual-band 5GHz Wi-Fi router can be controlled via an app. You can change settings and shift modes through the app remotely. It is an ideal router for a family, and 4K streaming would never be difficult again. It consists of an extremely secure server so that no hacker tends to mess up with your device or use your internet.

Conclusion

item.title: Ryzen 5 5600X Benchmark using CPU-Z Software
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: It’s been three weeks since AMD announced their new line up of Ryzen CPUs. It’s no surprise a lot of PC gamers join the online event, as Dr. Lisa Su called it “Where Gaming Begins”. One CPU included in line up of Ryzen 5000 series is the Ryzen 5 5600X. It is a 6 core ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
It’s been three weeks since AMD announced their new line up of Ryzen CPUs. It’s no surprise a lot of PC gamers join the online event, as Dr. Lisa Su called it “Where Gaming Begins”.

One CPU included in line up of Ryzen 5000 series is the Ryzen 5 5600X. It is a 6 core and 12 threads processor with a base clock speed of 3.7 Ghz (which can boost up to 4.5 Ghz) along with a 35 MB of Level three cache (L3 cache). This CPU seems to become a powerhouse for $299.

We’ve seen a lot of benchmark leaks in the past few days, including PassMark latest CPU rankings, where the Ryzen 5 5600X dominates every single Intel processors in both single thread and multi-threaded performance. But how about using the other software like CPU-Z?

One of the first users of the Ryzen 5 5600X shows their first test result. (Leaker)

Using the CPU-Z software, the Ryzen 5 5600X scores 643 points in the single-thread performance, and 4814 points in multi-threads. The Ryzen 5 5600X preserves its position, and still dominating every single Intel processor.

Single and Multi-Threaded Score of Ryzen 5 5600X:

item.title: Is It Better to Build or Buy a Gaming PC?
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: PC gaming is more well known than ever, and it’s actually quite easy to see why. We’ve got things like exclusive games, exclusive genres, and of course the ability to play on any screen with any resolution and refresh rate you want. But at the same time, there’s a serious huge hindrance for new players ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
PC gaming is more well known than ever, and it’s actually quite easy to see why. We’ve got things like exclusive games, exclusive genres, and of course the ability to play on any screen with any resolution and refresh rate you want. But at the same time, there’s a serious huge hindrance for new players into this platform, and that’s the PC itself. And there’s often a question that comes up, which is whether it’s worth building your own PC or just going out and getting a Prebuilt one. In this article, I’m going to tell you right now that there is no definitive right or wrong answer. However, I wanted to help out where I could, and to show you the advantages and disadvantages of doing either.

Is it Cheaper to build or buy a Gaming PC?

One of the daunting questions from beginners in the PC world is: is it cheaper to build a PC? or should I just buy a Prebuilt one? In general, it is less expensive to assemble a gaming PC as opposed to purchasing a pre-built one. And the reason is that you are not paying an additional fee for the assembly cost and net margin associated with Prebuilt PCs. Most of the time, the more costly a Prebuilt PC is, the higher the expense of PC assembly and the net margin of the vendor will be. Therefore, it’s truly cheaper to build a PC than buying a Prebuilt one. Notwithstanding, you relinquish the time and less danger of harming the PC parts if you choose to build a PC from scratch as opposed to purchasing a pre-built one.

Advantages Of Building Your Own PC:

It’s Easy to Build a PC

Building a PC is easier than it’s ever been. We’re not talking back to the days when you had comm ports, game ports, printer ports, serial buses, and all sorts of things that we needed to be configured to even work properly. We never had a chance of even getting your computer to post or boot if you didn’t have things set properly. However, we’re lucky because those days are long gone. Although, there are so many articles that want to make it sound like computers are dead is completely false. In fact, we are at the highest popularity PCs have ever been in, and that’s because of the popularity of streaming and the amount of gaming that is out there. When it comes to installing your parts, your graphics card can only fit in one particular slot type, and your motherboard is written in plain English to tell you which slot you should use. In terms of RAM, it only goes in one place, which makes it the easiest component to install. And it is the same with the CPU, the AMD is the easiest CPUs to install but things are more rugged, ESD protection now is built into the motherboard so you can’t necessarily accidentally shock it very easily and kill your stuff.

It’s Cheaper to Build a PC

Just like what I said above, it is cheaper to build a gaming PC. By building your own PC, you are not paying extra for the assembly cost and profit margin associated with Prebuilt PCs, but you invest your own time and increases the chances of harming the PC parts either. However, as I said above, building a PC is way easier than it’s ever been, and there are so many PC building tutorials out there.

Fully Control Over your PC & Gain More Experience

Building your own PC will allow you to be able to fully control the parts that go into your system. The fact that you can control your own parts means you can save a little here and spend a little more there. Also, Building your own PC will help you learn something new and will save you from different circumstances like when something goes wrong, you are able to fix it because you have the knowledge to do it yourself. Gaining experience in PC building is more like an accomplishment, yes, I’m referring to all the hard work that you’re gonna put in building your system. The feeling that you can sit there, look at it, and say I earned that. Most PC builders say that it’s more enjoyable to build a PC than the actual gaming with it.

Disadvantages:

No System Builder Warranty and Tech Support

You, being the system builder means you’ve got to warranty it and back it yourself all the labor. You should also be the one who will be fixing it and then hopefully being able to actually diagnose what’s gone wrong. So, sometimes people just are not comfortable with that. You don’t have online tech support that you can call for help to get your system up and running with as minimal downtime as possible.

Compatibility Errors

As innovation pushes ahead, and more advanced components are made available, compatibility issues are arising. Computer components may not be compatible with what’s on the shelf today. For example, because the CPU might have come out after this motherboard and although this motherboard is gonna support it, it needs to be updated first, but you can’t update the CPU they bought right there, so you gotta do some sort of a BIOS flashback, which might be a bit complicated for beginners. Compatibility and trying to choose the right parts so you won’t waste any money is where the real challenge with PC building.

Advantages Of Buying A Prebuilt PC:

Time and Convenience

Most important of these have definitely got to be time and convenience. To put it bluntly, it takes a long time to build a PC since you’re buying all the parts separately. There is no reason to make all of your purchases in one place. Maybe you’ll find some good discounts and a couple of pieces of hardware at your local retailer, but you will still want to order other components online. It can take a while before all of the hardware is actually on your table to start building. But Prebuilt PCs are just a click or a drive away, if you can find one at your local retailer you can start gaming on it on the same day you make the purchase. They even come with Windows preinstalled most of the time, so really all you need to do is plug in the peripherals and you’re good to go, which will help you to get rid of all the bloatware that will probably be waiting for you. So, if you just want a good gaming PC now and you don’t want to bother finding all the best prices for each individual component and then fitting them all together, you’ll find a lot of value in pre-built PCs.

Compatible Parts

So also, the client will never need to stress over PC parts compatibility when purchasing a pre-built PC. And it’s not even conceivable to commit an error in this perspective as these PCs arrive already assembled and appropriately tried.

PC Warranty

Unlike when constructing your own gaming PC, you have full tech support from the vendor when you purchase a pre-built PC. In the case of something turning out badly, or if any of the PC Parts gets damaged in shipping, you may just call the manufacturer right away for a replacement.

Disadvantages:

Lack of Customization

We all know how important customizability can be for PC gamers. Not only in terms of function but form as well. High-end pre-built PCs are rather easy on the eyes, but chances are they’ll never look exactly the way you’d wanted to your ideal PC. Maybe, the RGB stripes will be in the wrong places, or maybe you’ll be locked into LED lights that just aren’t the right color for you. You probably won’t turn down a deal on a great pre-built PC just because of the wrong LED lights, but you will have to look at that computer every day for the foreseeable future. Now, in all fairness, buyers have more options today when it comes to pre-built PCs than ever before, but these options are mostly concerned with RAM and storage capacities or bumping the CPU or GPU up a notch. The choice of motherboard however is set in stone as is the cooling solution and the power supply.

It’s Expensive to Buy a Prebuilt PC

Building a PC requires time and knowledge. Not every person can plunk down parts scattered on the table, and get to the PC building. Depending on your setup, it may take a few hours, sometimes over a day to get your PC setup done and running. Also, cable management is a tricky task that can lead to more harm than good in inexperienced hands. These tasks come only in premium pre-built PCs. The producer does all the messy work so you don’t need to. Be that as it may, they likewise add assembly expenses to the bill, which can now and then altogether increment the last cost of the PC.

Modifying or Upgrading the Prebuilt PC will Void the Warranty

It’s difficult to perform upgrades on the Prebuilt PC without sacrificing the warranty. Tampering with the hardware of a pre-built PC in any way will typically bring about voiding its warranty. With that said, there is no opportunity to modify, disassemble, or in any case control the parts without potentially forfeiting manufacturer support. Although, it takes years for a PC to require an upgrade, by which point the warranty will be expired, anyway. We can’t still keep away from the shifting activities we do on our PC, which will sometimes require us to upgrade, especially if the activity you do reaches the capacity of your pre-built PC.

Conclusion

As should be obvious, the fight between pre-built and custom-built PCs isn’t so uneven. Everything comes down to you, the purchaser. It relies upon what you need from your PC if all you need is to get the best possible performance for your cash, at that point, making your own PC from scratch is the best approach. On the other hand, on the off chance that you need a PC right away and you would prefer not to stress over it at all for a long time to come, you can’t go wrong with a pre-built one.

item.title: How To Overclock The RTX 2070 Graphics Card
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: In this guide, I’m going to teach you how you can overclock your RTX 2070 graphics card with a very simple trick. One of my favorite things about RTX cards is the automatic overclocking feature, where you can get a hassle-free and stable overclock. The days where you manually configure settings to get a high-performance ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
In this guide, I’m going to teach you how you can overclock your RTX 2070 graphics card with a very simple trick. One of my favorite things about RTX cards is the automatic overclocking feature, where you can get a hassle-free and stable overclock. The days where you manually configure settings to get a high-performance overclock are already gone. So, the thing we should be focused on is automatic overclocking, which works only on any RTX graphics cards including RTX 2070. I am using MSI Afterburner since the feature is not yet supported in some software like Gigabyte Aorus Graphics Engine.

For this, we require you to get the latest beta version of MSI Afterburner to take advantage of it’s automatic overclocking. So, to get to the automatic overclocking utility, you must first press CTRL-F. This brings up the voltage frequency curve editor.

In the top right corner of the window there is the OC scanner, click on it and close the frequency curve editor and you will see the MSI overclocking scanner window.

There are two options available there Test and Scan. Tests will check for stability, and Scan will give you a high performance overclocking. Click the Test first, then scan. And in around 20 minutes, your overclock will be configured.

Here is the overclock provided by the MSI scanner:

After the MSI scanner is done, apply the settings in MSI Afterburner then save it to a profile.

This GPU-Z screen shows the specs of the stock RTX 2070 along with the same window after applying the overclock from the OC scanner.

You can see that the GPU clocks and boost clocks have a good increase. In games, the clock speeds will be even higher. For me, the number in games is typically somewhere above 1900 megahertz. With the OC scanner, you could have more performance than some factory overclocked RTX 2070s.

item.title: Best Keyboard For Large Hands
item.dc:creator: Henzon
item.description: Why should people with large hands use a special keyboard? The answer is simple: having large hands and using a keyboard for normal-sized people will be extremely uncomfortable, and your gaming or work experience will surely be dire because when trying to press a key they press the ones that are around. You could buy ... Read more
item.content:encoded:
Why should people with large hands use a special keyboard? The answer is simple: having large hands and using a keyboard for normal-sized people will be extremely uncomfortable, and your gaming or work experience will surely be dire because when trying to press a key they press the ones that are around. You could buy a normal size keyboard; however, it would take you too long to get used to something that was simply not made specifically for people like you. Again, very uncomfortable and it ruins the experience, that it should be a nice moment. Constantly, people with big hands will need to press the same key multiple times because the keyboard keeps registering about three other letters. People with big hands need a big gaming keyboard for their conformity, but finding a good one is a nightmare for some people because almost all the keyboards are common size. There are a lot of options for people will large hands, such as:

A keyboard with stiff switches. Miss-typing will be no problem. For example, Ducky Shane 6 or IKBC New Poker II Mechanical Keyboard and a keyboard with some large keys. They are not very common and you will be very limited when choosing. Also, they are usually very basic keyboards but they are still an option. For example, AbleNet BigKeys LX or Chester Creek vision board.

But, why would you buy a stiff switches keyboard or a keyboard with large keys when you can buy a large keyboard? A keyboard like that should and will cover all of your needs, while stiff switches keyboards will only help with the miss-typing and a keyboard with some large keys will help a little, but the problem will be still there. Those two keyboards will be a waste of money, but especial keyboards will do the job quite well.

You might also like to check out our list of the Best Portable mechanical Keywords that are suitable for both gaming and work.

Read also: Best White Gaming Monitors

What are the features to look up to when choosing a keyboard for big hands?

The first thing on your list should be the comfortability. What is the point of buying a keyboard if it is not comfortable? Smoothness is also another important feature to look for. A smooth keyboard with responsive keys will make typing and gaming easier. Durability is another feature that should be important to anyone that is choosing a new keyboard to buy and does not want to spend money on keyboards every month.

item.title: Best Portable Mechanical Keyboard

item.content:encoded:
If you consider it’s time to replace your old keyboard, getting a portable mechanical keyboard instead of a normal one might be a better idea. Compared to normal keyboards, portable mechanical keyboards are easier to carry around because of their compact size. These keyboards don’t feature a number pad, and they are usually used for gaming or work thanks to their durability and longer lifespan. Despite the fact that the number pad is missing, the layout of a portable mechanical keyboard is similar to a normal keyboard.

Usually, portable mechanical keyboards cost more than full-size keyboards. However, they come with many high-tech features. Because of its size, it is easier to organize a desk, and it’s very comfortable to use. Normally, they are equipped with mechanical switches, and you can also remove and replace the keycaps. This type of keyboard is especially suitable for people who spend many hours a day in front of a computer. Its space-friendly feature provides mobility, and it’s easy to carry it in a laptop bag or a backpack.

If you want to find out more, here is a list of the best portable mechanical keyboards. This list contains reviews and information for each keyboard to provide more insight.

Read Also: Best keyboards For Large Hands

SteelSeries Apex M750 TKL Mechanical Keyboard

This is a durable gaming keyboard with an aluminum frame and a black matte color to give it a stylish design. The frame provides lightweight, zero flexibility, and a solid base suitable for mechanical switches. The SteelSeries Apex M750 TKL is compact, so you can easily carry it in a small backpack anywhere you go. This keyboard features a QX2 mechanical switch with low force and direct actuation point, making it perfect for faster gameplay. The switch also provides a tactile response for natural movement, eliminating the risk of missing important keystrokes. The displays real-time discord chat notifications and other messages, and it also shows you the status of your microphone. The lighting of the keyboard is highly customizable due to the PrismSync lighting gear. Using the keyboard’s software, you can further enhance your gaming experience by customizing the keys, macros, and profiling. To improve in-game efficiency, SteelSeries Apex M750 TKL delivers OLED messages and tactile alerts. Also, the lighting of the keyboard reacts to in-game events.

Keyboard main features:

  • Chat notification
  • Pre-key RGB lighting
  • It’s compact and easy to carry
  • QX2 mechanical switches
  • Highly customizable

Ajazz AK33 Geek RGB

The Ajazz AK33 is among the most popular portable mechanical keyboards, especially because it’s cheaper than the average keyboard. The lighting effects are provided by a backlighting RGB key. It has an impressive variety of lighting effects. The keyboard is designed to offer durability and responsiveness. Ajazz AK33 comes with black mechanical switches, and each key has a different switch. Ajazz AK33 is small and you can easily carry it in a bag or a wrap. The minimalist design of the keyboard allows you to have more space on your desk. The portability if further increased by the removable USB cable. It is also pretty stylish and it looks nice on a working desk or beside a gaming setup.

Keyboard main features:

  • Compact layout
  • Portability
  • It’s cheap
  • RGB lighting with many effects
  • Good durability

MSI Vigor GK70 Mechanical Gaming Keyboard

The MSI Vigor GK70 is one of the best portable mechanical keyboards, and it is designed specifically for gaming. The aluminum frame ensures durability and the keys feel nice to the touch. Vigor GK70 uses the Cherry MX Red mechanical switch that guarantees a quick response in fast-paced games and low actuation force. Some of the nicest features of this keyboard are the N-key rollover and Anti-ghosting technology, a Windows key used to prevent inconveniences. The USB cable is also very durable. The lighting of the keyboard relies on the MSI Mystic Light Sync software. With this software, you can easily customize the lighting effects as you please. The WASD keys are made from zinc alloy, and they are perfect for long gaming sessions. This keyboard also comes with 12 double injection rubber keycaps. The special FN multimedia keys, MACRO, and a repeat rate adjustment are a nice touch and they make this keyboard unique. When it comes to portability, this keyboard is small, lightweight, and it’s easy to carry in a small bag. While using this keyboard, you will be pleased to see how much space you can save on your desk.

Keyboard main features:

  • Designed for gaming

Razer BlackWidow X Tournament Edition

This is a portable mechanical keyboard from Razer, and it delivers a perfect balance between performance and durability. The Razer BlackWidow X is nicely designed, and the case is made of military-grade metal. Overall, the sturdiness and the design of this keyboard are perfect for intense gaming sessions. The green mechanical switches from Razer are highly responsive and they work really well in games where fast reactions are required. There is a similarity between the green switches from Razer and MX Cherry switches. The lighting features 16.8 million colors, and you can create any effect or color pattern you like using the keyboard’s software. BlackWidow X is easy to clean because it has an exposed backplate. This keyboard is also useful if you want to save space thanks to its compact design.

Corsair K63 Compact Mechanical Keyboard

The Corsair K63 is slightly bigger compared to other keyboards on this list, but it meets the requirements to make it a suitable keyboard for gaming or work. Similar to other portable mechanical keyboards, Corsair K63 also comes with Windows special keys and brightness control. Despite the fact that the keys are a bit heavier, they are made from a material that feels very nice while typing. Features like NKRO with Anti-ghosting technology make sure your gaming experience is not ruined by unregistered keystrokes. You can regulate the lighting with Corsair’s software. The software is free and you can acquire it from their website. However, the software is compatible only with the most recent Windows versions. The Cherry MX red mechanical switches are highly responsive, and the red LED backlight creates a nice ambiance in the dark. Even though it’s heavier than other keyboards, Corsair K63 is still easy to carry around.

Keyboard main features:

  • Portability
  • Lighting adjustment
  • Cherry MX switches
  • Dedicated keys

HyperX Alloy FPS PRO Mechanical Keyboard

The Alloy FPS PRO from HyperX is an ultra-compact keyboard designed for FPS enthusiasts, but it can be used for other tasks too. This mechanical keyboard enhances the in-game experience, and it’s popular among people who value accuracy and fast responding keys. The structure of the keyboard is made from a durable metal alloy. Besides durability, the frame of the keyboard provides stability too. Thanks to its compact design, you can save a lot of space on your desk. The USB cable is detachable, making the transportation and the packing of the keyboard easier. Also, similar to other portable mechanical keyboards, the Numpad is missing. So, you can use the mouse more freely. The precision and the reliability of the keyboard are ensured by the Cherry MX mechanical switches. This is always important for people who want to improve their gaming skills.

Cooler Master Pro M White

This keyboard has a simple design, but that doesn’t mean it’s not as better as other portable mechanical keyboards on this list. Cooler Master Pro M White comes with many interesting features. The keyboard features Cherry MX red, brown, and blue mechanical switches. The keys are made by ABS, and the material that covers the USB cable offers protection against sharp objects. There are FN keys to control lighting effects, multimedia, and MACROS. These features are always useful for both gaming and work. The 6 key-rollover, N-key rollover, and anti-ghosting are the features that make this keyboard so reliable. Through Cooler Master’s RGB lighting software you can customize the lighting effects as you like. You can also create and customize profiles. The compact design of Cooler Master Pro M White ensures easy transportation and packing.

Mechanical Eagle Z-77 TKL

The Eagle Z-77 is a compact keyboard designed for gamers and for people who need to travel a lot. The sturdiness and the durability of this keyboard are ensured by the metal with matte-finish and the waterproof top-graded ABS material. Mechanical Eagle Z-77 features laser-engraved keys and three drain holes. The keyboard looks very nice thanks to its stepped keycap. The slope and the arc are designed to fit your hand to prevent fatigue and wrist injuries. Mechanical Eagle Z-77 comes with replaceable DIY blue switches, and it also has 5 free PCS switches. The durability of the switches is on point, and the responsiveness is great. The keys feature low resistance and tactile feedback. Like other keyboards on this list, Eagle Z-77 also features FN multimedia keys and anti-ghosting technology. The switches are Outemu blue. Despite the fact that they are not the popular Cherry MX, they are still good and suitable for writing. The tactile bump and then click at the activation point are satisfying to feel and hear, and they offer comfort while writing. Eagle Z-77 comes with colorful lighting and a variety of lighting modes. You can customize the lighting to create your own patterns. You can also choose which keys you want to light up.

Keyboard main features:

  • Shortcut keys

The 84-key layout and the elegant design will ensure you the best user experience. Drevo Excalibur is a combination of beauty and efficiency. If you prefer a certain mechanical style, this keyboard gives you the option to choose between Cherry black, blue, brown, and red switches. The aluminum casing offers protection and stability, and the design of the keyboard is further enhanced by a mounting plate and LED back-lighting. The texture of the keyboard feels nice and it delivers comfort and smoothness. However, the style and the smoothness of this keyboard is not the only benefit associated with the design. It is also compact and lightweight, making it perfect for transportation. The lighting is customizable, and this keyboard also comes with anti-ghosting technology to prevent in-game problems.

Velocifire TKL02 Mechanical Keyboard

Velocifire TKL02 is a portable mechanical keyboard suitable for gamers, writers, copywriters, and editors. This keyboard features brown mechanical switches, and it delivers many other features for a decent price. You can place this keyboard anywhere and save a lot of space thanks to its compact design. The brown mechanical switches come with a tactile bump, which is great for feedback to improve precision and typing speed. The durability of this keyboard is ensured by the sturdy keys. The surface of the keycaps is dust and waterproof because it’s made from a durable top-grade material. Furthermore, the keys are laser engraved, which means they will not fade that easily. When it comes to compatibility, you can use the Velocifire TKL02 with any Windows version and Linux. You can also use the Velocifire TKL02 to transfer files because it contains a USB connector.

Fnatic Mini Streak Pro Gaming

The Fnatic Mini Streak is the best portable gaming keyboard for you if you want to improve your gaming skills. This keyboard features a stylish design and sturdy plastic material. It is also very reliable and lightweight. Its unique layout and durable casing will improve your gaming experience immediately. This keyboard comes with multi-color RGB lighting, a comfortable wrist rest, and MX Blue switches. It also delivers dedicated FN multimedia keys and anti-ghosting technology. The rest of the wrist is made from leather, and the USB cable is detachable. You can customize the lighting effects and the color patterns using the keyboard’s software. Fnatic Mini Streak weighs only 1.5 pounds and it measures 14.8 x 8.6 x 2.9 inches. If you want to take it with you to the office or a friend’s house, you can do it easily. However, despite its size, it is also very durable. The onboard memory is another nice feature, and you can use it to save your profile settings.

Conclusion

Portable mechanical keyboards are compact, lightweight, and you can take them with you anywhere. The absence of the number pad seems an inconvenience at first, but it’s actually better if you want to save some space on your desk. It doesn’t matter if you want to use it for gaming, writing, or editing. These keyboards are suitable for any task. They provide the durability and functionality of a full-size keyboard.

item.content:encoded:
Streaming on Twitch or YouTube does not always require the best equipment to do the job but if you want the best experience providing entertainment, consider investing in some high-quality products. Purchasing the equipment does require a little research to know the reliability and quality of the products you have in mind. It does not always hurt to go a little further to purchase a headset that has extra features on it that others do not. If you have a full set up, one of the most important pieces of equipment you need is a headset to hear the game or music with the best sound quality along with the ability to communicate to the streams chat with a high-quality microphone. Two more key aspects in purchasing a headset are knowing that it is comfortable and has the fitting that you desire, as well as knowing if you would like the headset to be wireless or wired. Always know what you are looking for and pay attention to detail so you can find the headset to give you better gaming and streaming experience. Don’t forget to compare prices between the headsets as some headsets are quite expensive.

Best Headset for Streaming on Twitch:

SteelSeries Arctis 7 – Wireless

A popular headset used for streaming is the SteelSeries Arctis 7 Wireless. Arctic 7 has been voted as the best gaming headset by some of the most popular review sites and magazines. According to Amazon, it has a rating of nearly 4 1/2 stars. The headset consists of a long life with a 24-hour battery when fully charged, no lag interference due to the 2.4G connection, AirWeave cushions to maintain comfortability, along with a volume control wheel, including mute and off buttons on the left earpiece. 

The headset also includes a 12-meter range to allow you to continuously talk to your stream’s chat or teammates. The Arctis 7 comes with a ClearCast microphone to ensure high-quality voice communication. The SteelSeries Arctis 7 is compatible with PC, MAC, PlayStation, the Switch Nintendo, and any mobile device.

Sennheiser Game ONE – Wired

The Sennheiser Game ONE is a wired headset that provides some of the best gaming audio there is to experience. It has a rating of 4 stars on Amazon. The headset comes with very comforting XXL velvet plush pads to allow gaming for hours. Just like the Arctis 7, the Game ONE provides clear, noise-canceling conversations with your chat and friends. The microphone boom also includes a mute feature as you lift it. 

There are volume controls included on the right earpiece as well. The Sennheiser Game ONE is compatible with many platforms that include; PC, MACs, any console, and mobile devices that are equipped with a 3.5 mm audio jack input.

Logitech G430 – Wired

The Logitech G430 7.1 Dolby is a wired headset with a current rating of 4 stars on Amazon and an extremely low price. The Logitech as of now is only available in one design. The headset allows full surround sound hearing within a game that features a 360-degree sound field to give you a full sound experience. The Logitech G430 includes a set of soft sport cloth pads to comfort you while you game or stream. 

The mic included has a fold-up feature along with a noise-canceling boom mic to give high-quality voice audio to your stream. The Logitech headset also includes the volume controls located in the cable that plugs into the device you are using. The Logitech G430 7.1 Dolby is compatible with PS4/XBOX ONE, PC with audio jack input, Windows 10, Windows 8, and Windows 7.

CORSAIR Void PRO RGB – Wireless

The CORSAIR Void PRO RGB is a wireless headset that has a very different design than any other headset that comes with a stand that includes a charging port. The CORSAIR Void PRO RGB is rated at 4 stars on Amazon. The headset is purchasable in two colors, black or white, whichever you prefer. The headset is equipped with LED lights; red to let you know when the headset is on low battery, amber to show that the charge is 20% or higher, as green shows that the headset is fully charged as that provides up to 16 hours of battery life. 

The Void PRO is equipped with a microfiber mesh fabric over memory foam comfort for your hour-long streams. The headset comes with an amazing feature that allows you to travel 40 meters before the headset is finally out of range. The CORSAIR Void PRO RGB is compatible with PC with a USB port, Windows 10, Windows 8, and Windows 7.

Sennheiser GSP 550 – Wired

The wired Sennheiser GSP 550 headset is one of Sennheiser’s most popular gaming headsets that only comes in at a rating of 3.5 stars on Amazon. The headset looks to be bulky and resemble military-like colors as it only has one design coming in green and black. The headset has a 7.1 Dolby surround sound feature that gives a better experience for gamers and viewers while streaming on Twitch or any platform. The headset like many others reduces background noise but shares a similar feature as the Sennheiser Game ONE which mutes your microphone when you raise it up until you put back down. 

The headset is made to only be used with PC though it is wired. The headset is less cushioned on the earpieces but still provides a cushioning above your head that includes an adjustable feature to resize the headset to your comfort unlike the other headsets listed. Just like other headsets, it comes with the ability to control the volume that is located on the right ear of the headset.
